member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHost.NotifyBeginApplication
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, notifies the host that the Windows PowerShell runtime is about to execute a legacy command-line application. A legacy application is defined as a console-mode executable that can perform any of the following operations: read from stdin, write to stdout, write to stderr, or use any of the Windows console functions.
member.exception: The host can throw this exception when it cannot complete an operation.
A non-interactive host should throw a "not implemented" exception when it receives this call.
The host can throw this exception when an error occurs while a command is running.

remarks.para: The Windows PowerShell engine can call this method several times in the course of a single pipeline. For example, the pipeline abc.exe | bar-cmdlet | baz.exe causes a sequence of calls similar to the following:

item.description: NotifyBeginApplication: Called once when abc.exe is started.
NotifyBeginApplication: Called once when baz.exe is started.
NotifyEndApplication: Called once when baz.exe terminates.
NotifyEndApplication: Called once when abc.exe terminates.

remarks.para: Note that the order in which the NotifyEndApplication method call follows its corresponding NotifyBeginApplication method call is not defined and should not be depended upon. In other words, the NotifyBeginApplication method can be called several times before a corresponding NotifyEndApplication method is called.The only thing that is guaranteed is that there will be an equal number of calls to the NotifyBeginApplication and NotifyEndApplication methods.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHost.NotifyEndApplication
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, notifies the host that the Windows PowerShell engine has completed the execution of a legacy command. A legacy application is defined as a console-mode executable that can perform any of the following operations: read from stdin, write to stdout, write to stderr, or use any of the Windows console functions.
member.exception: The host can throw this exception when it cannot complete an operation.
A non-interactive host should throw a "not implemented" exception when it receives this call.
The host can throw this exception when an error occurs while a command is running.
member.remarks: Note that the order in which the NotifyEndApplication method call follows its corresponding NotifyBeginApplication method is not defined and should not be depended upon. In other words, the NotifyBeginApplication method can be called several times before a corresponding NotifyEndApplication method is called. The only thing that is guaranteed is that there will be an equal number of calls to the NotifyBeginApplication and NotifyEndApplication methods.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHost.SetShouldExit(System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, requests to end the current runspace. The Windows PowerShell engine calls this method to request that the host application shut down and terminate the host root runspace.
member.param: The exit code that is used to set the host's process exit code.
member.exception: The host can throw this exception when it cannot complete an operation.
The host can throw this exception when an error occurs while a command is running.
member.remarks: To honor this request, the host application should stop accepting and submitting commands to the engine and close the runspace.

member.name: T:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI
member.summary: Custom Implementation of PSHostUserInterface for the PSClientHost object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the prompt callback; argument names: caption, message, descriptions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the write callback; argument names: level, foregroundColor, backgroundColor, message.

member.summary: Gets or sets the prompt for choice callback; argument names: caption, message, choices, defaultChoice.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.PromptForCredentialsCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the prompt for credentials callback; argument names: caption, message, userName, targetName, allowedCredentialTypes, options.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.ReadLineCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the read line callback.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteProgressCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the write progress callback; argument names: sourceId, record.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.RawUI
member.summary: Gets the PowerShell Host Raw User Interface Object.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteToLog(PowerShellClient.PSOutputStream,System.Nullable{System.ConsoleColor},System.Nullable{System.ConsoleColor},System.String)
member.summary: Appends the specified message to the running log without any newlines, etc. (Might be a partial line.)
member.param: The write level.
The foreground color of the display.
The background color of the display.
The message.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.Prompt(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{System.Management.Automation.Host.FieldDescription})
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prompts the user for input.
member.param: The text that precedes the prompt.
The text of the prompt.
A collection of objects that contains the user input.
member.returns: A dictionary of types and that contains the results of the user prompts. The keys of the dictionary are the field names from the FieldDescription objects. The dictionary values are objects that represent the values of the corresponding fields as collected from the user.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.PromptForChoice(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{System.Management.Automation.Host.ChoiceDescription},System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, provides a set of choices that enable the user to choose a single option from a set of options.
member.param: The text that precedes (a title) the choices.
A message that describes the choice.
A collection of objects that describe each choice.
The default choice.
member.returns: The index of the Choices parameter collection element that corresponds to the option that is selected by the user.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.PromptForCredential(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prompts the user for credentials with a specified prompt window caption, prompt message, user name, and target name.
member.param: The caption for the message window.
The text of the message.
The user name whose credential is to be prompted for. If this parameter set to null or an empty string, the function prompts for the user name first.
The name of the target for which the credential is collected.
member.returns: A object that contains the credentials for the target.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.PromptForCredential(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Management.Automation.PSCredentialTypes,System.Management.Automation.PSCredentialUIOptions)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prompts the user for credentials by using a specified prompt window caption, prompt message, user name and target name, credential types allowed to be returned, and UI behavior options.
member.param: The caption for the message window.
The text of the message.
The user name whose credential is to be prompted for. If this parameter set to null or an empty string, the function prompts for the user name first.
The name of the target for which the credential is collected.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that identify the types of credentials that can be returned.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that identify the UI behavior when it gathers the credentials.
member.returns: A object that contains the credentials for the target.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.ReadLine
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads characters that are entered by the user until a newline (carriage return) character is encountered.
member.returns: The characters that are entered by the user.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.ReadLineAsSecureString
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads characters entered by the user until a newline (carriage return) character is encountered and returns the characters as a secure string.
member.returns: A SecureString object that contains the characters that are entered by the user.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.Write(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes characters to the output display of the host.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.Write(System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes characters to the output display of the host with possible foreground and background colors.
member.param: The foreground color of the display.
The background color of the display.
The characters to be written.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteDebugLine(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, displays a debug message to the user.
member.param: Debug message to be displayed.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteErrorLine(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a line to the error display of the host.
member.param: Error message to be displayed.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a line of characters to the output display of the host and appends a newline (carriage return) character.
member.param: The line of characters to be written.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteProgress(System.Int64,System.Management.Automation.ProgressRecord)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a progress report to be displayed to the user.
member.param: A unique identifier of the source of the record.
A ProgressRecord object that contains the progress record to be displayed.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteVerboseLine(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a verbose line to be displayed to the user.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSClientHostUI.WriteWarningLine(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a warning line to be displayed to the user.

member.name: T:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo
member.summary: Connection Info object for creating a PSClient.

member.name: F:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.DefaultRemotePowerShellPort
member.summary: The default Remote PowerShell port.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.UseSecurePowerShell
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not a secure connection is required.
member.value: true if a secure connection is required; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Note that if RequireValidCertificate is set to false, that the connection isn't really secure. It's just using a secure port and protocol (in an insecure way).

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.RequireValidCertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the SSL certificate must be validated or not.
member.remarks: This is set to false by default, as it requires a fair bit of setup to get it to work on a given machine.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.ComputerAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the Remote Computer Address.
member.value: IP Address, Machine Name (local network), FQDN, etc. of the remote computer.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port used to connect to the Remote Computer.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.Credentials
member.summary: Gets or sets the Credentials to be used by the remote connection.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection timeout.

member.name: P:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.OperationTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation timeout.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.IsLocalConnection
member.summary: Returns true if the connection is a local one; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.CreateRemoteConnection(System.String,System.String,System.Security.SecureString,System.Nullable{System.UInt16})
member.summary: Creates Remote PowerShell Connection Information for a given computer, using a standard UserName and Password combination.
member.param: The computer address (IP Address, Machine Name (local network), FQDN, etc.)
The UserName to connect with.
The Password to connect with.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.CreateLocalConnection
member.summary: Creates a object that represents a connection to the local machine (i.e. allows you to use to library for non-remote connections).

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.ToRunspaceConnectionInfo
member.summary: Converts this instance into runspace connection information.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSConnectionInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.

member.summary: Gets the size of a remote file asynchronously.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSFileSystem.GetFileHash(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the hash of a remote file.
member.param: The remote file path.
The hashing algorithm to use (default is MD5).

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSFileSystem.GetFileHashAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the hash of a remote file asynchronously.
member.param: The remote file path.
The hashing algorithm to use (default is MD5).

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSFileSystem.PutFile(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Puts a file on the remote machine.
member.param: The path to the file.
The raw binary contents of the file.
true to unblock the file after it's created; otherwise false.

member.summary: Puts a file on the remote machine asynchronously.
member.param: The path to the file.
The raw binary contents of the file.
true to unblock the file after it's created; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSFileSystem.UnzipTo(System.IO.Compression.ZipArchive,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Unzips the supplied zip file to the specified remote file system path.
member.param: The zip file.
The path on the remote file system where the zip file should be unzipped.
A cancellation token to abort the unzipping operation.

member.name: T:PowerShellClient.PSUtils
member.summary: Static Utility Methods for working with PowerShell.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.Stringify(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a random object to a string that we can write out to the console / log file.
member.param: The input object.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.EscapeVariableName(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a string into the raw name of a variable.
member.param: The name of the variable (without the dollar sign or escape characters).

returns.para: An escaped proper variable name (including the dollar sign and curly braces).

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.EscapeString(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a raw string value into a formatted and escaped string literal that can be used in a raw PowerShell script.
member.param: The raw string value to be escaped.
member.returns: A formatted and escaped string literal that can be inserted into a powershell script verbatim, includes proper quotes and escape characters.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.CreateCommand(System.String,System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a PowerShell that can be Invoked by an object that implements .
member.param: The name of the cmdlet to invoke.
An anonymous object containing the parameters for the cmdlet.
A collection of switches for the cmdlet.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.ConvertToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary: Uses reflection to convert anonymous objects, KeyValue pairs, or even regular objects into dictionaries for easy inspection.
member.param: The object to be converted into a dictionary.
member.returns: A case-insensitive dictionary which contains the properties and values of the object that was passed in.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.ConfigureNonInteractiveConsoleHost(PowerShellClient.IPSClient)
member.summary: Configures a connected PowerShell session to write its output to the Console.
member.param: The connected instance to configure.
member.returns: true if configuration is successful; otherwise false.
member.remarks: The PowerShell session must be open and connected, or this method will not succeed; additionally if you close and re-open it, it will need to be configured again.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.ConfigureNonInteractiveSilentHost(PowerShellClient.IPSClient)
member.summary: Configures a connected PowerShell session to swallow any output.
member.param: The connected instance to configure.
member.returns: true if configuration is successful; otherwise false.
member.remarks: The PowerShell session must be open and connected, or this method will not succeed; additionally if you close and re-open it, it will need to be configured again.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.GetSingleException(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the object into a single .
member.param: The input object.
member.returns: An exception representatitve of the passed in object.

member.name: M:PowerShellClient.PSUtils.GetAllExceptions(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the object into an array of s; flattening any s.
member.param: The input object.
member.returns: An exception representatitve of the passed in object.
